Package server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
server.Server
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
The server class consists of the main logic of running the server. It is used to communicate with the Control Panel, and sends and receives request from it. The viewer also communicates with the server to query for active billboards.

  • Method Details

    • validateToken

      public static boolean validateToken​(java.lang.String sessionToken) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      Validates the provided session token.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token to be validated.
      Returns:
      Returns a Boolean which is true if the session token exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • getUsernameFromToken

      public static java.lang.String getUsernameFromToken​(java.lang.String sessionToken)
      Retrieves the username of the provided session token.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token to have the username retrieved from.
      Returns:
      Returns a String which is the username stored with the session token.

    • listenForConnections

      public static java.net.ServerSocket listenForConnections​(int port) throws java.io.IOException
      THis function creates a ServerSocket that is bound on the specified port.
      Parameters:
      port - An int which is the port number to begin listening on.
      Returns:
      Returns a ServerSocket bound on the given port number.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

    • logout

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge logout​(java.lang.String sessionToken)
      This logs the user out and the server-side expires the provided session token to log out the user.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token of the login to be terminated.
      Returns:
      Returns a ServerAcknowledge which is a message which determines whether the expiration was successful.

    • expireTokens

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge expireTokens​(java.lang.String username)
      Expires all session tokens with an associated user.
      Parameters:
      username - A String which is the username which will have all of its related tokens expired.
      Returns:
      Server acknowledgment enum to indicate whether the expiration of tokens was successful, or if an exception occurred (NoSuchUser means that the user requested could not be found).

    • login

      public static java.lang.Object login​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String hashedPassword) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      This logs in the user and the server-side login checks the username and password provided in the database, if they exist and are correctly matched, then a session token is created and returned.
      Parameters:
      username - A String which is the username entered by the user on the GUI.
      hashedPassword - A String which is the hashed version of the password entered by the user on the GUI.
      Returns:
      Returns an Object which is a valid session token for the user or server acknowledgment for user/password mismatch.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Throws an exception when the hashing algorithm requested does not exist.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
